intro: Lopezia angustifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf Lopezia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and small, daisy-like yellow flowers. This species typically grows in dry, rocky habitats, often in desert or scrubland environments. It is a perennial herb that produces small, wind-pollinated flowers, contributing to its role in local ecosystems. The plant's adaptability to arid conditions makes it an important component of its native flora.
